title.narrative: Primary Health Project in Herat Province

description.narrative: The objective of the project is divided with a humanitarian and two development objectives: The objectives strives to consolidate the health care system established in previous project phases in order to continue ensuring the basic human right to health for the population, with special focus on remote areas: Humanitarian: Access to and utilization of health services as specified in the Basic Package of Health Services and Essential Package of Hospital Services for the population in three districts in Herat Province. Nomadic and remote area populations will be reached by outreach services and mobile clinics. The results of the humanitarian objective are measures by the following indicators: Number of population served by outreach and mobile clinics, Number of births attended by skilled health worker, Number of pregnant women attending at least one ANC service as well as number of children under 1 year fully immunized. Development: 1. District health systems strengthened in three districts with emphasis on training and capacity development of Afghan individuals and systems. 2. Support to local community health development through training of community members and representatives in specific skills relevant for health and nutrition. The objectives are monitored by the number of individuals attending specified training and of females as regular shura members. DAC is running a district hospital, 18 health clinics and 227 health posts. The health posts consist of a married couple whereas the wife is trained as a birth attendant and the husband as a first-aider. They are also trained in basic counselling and in identifying high-risk-cases. The health posts acts as a referral point. DAC also runs three mobile health teams that focus on the far-to-reach areas. In 2014 DAC had around 312 local employees and one expatriate stationed in Herat. The DAC board members and the Copenhagen office play an important role as technical advisors to the implementation
